title: 107_hr344
content: The Act titled "Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001" eliminates the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits under the Social Security Act. Section 223(a)(2) of the Act is amended to simplify language, and section 223(c)(2) is repealed with conforming amendments made. Widow's Insurance Benefits Based on Disability are addressed in section 202(e)(1)(F) of the Act. Section 202(e)(1)(F) and 202(f)(1)(F) of the Social Security Act are amended to remove the waiting period for disability insurance benefits. Redesignation of paragraphs and elimination of defined terms are also included in the amendments. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability insurance benefits and redesignate paragraphs within the Act. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate waiting periods for disability insurance benefits and Medicare disability benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability insurance benefits and Medicare disability benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements for specified benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability insurance benefits and Medicare disability benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements for specified benefits. This includes amendments to various sections of the Act, such as removing the requirement of being entitled for 24 months for Medicare coverage and changing the language from "have been entitled" to "are entitled" for Medicare description. The Social Security Act is amended to remove waiting periods for disability insurance benefits and Medicare disability benefits, including changes to entitlement requirements for specified benefits. This includes amendments to various sections of the Act, such as removing the requirement of being entitled for 24 months for Medicare coverage and changing the language from "have been entitled" to "are entitled" for Medicare description. Effective dates are specified in Section 5. The amendments in the Social Security Act remove waiting periods for disability insurance benefits and Medicare disability benefits, with specific effective dates outlined for different sections of the Act. Section 4 of the Act removes waiting periods for insurance benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act, effective at least 90 days after enactment.
